**Note:** //It should be a noted that a SPOOKY female scream THAT SENDS SHIVERS DOWN YOUR SPINE from an indiscernible source can be heard after reading the rest of this HORRIFYING text.// -Scary Researcher Anderson!

+++ Anomalous Items 711 - 720

**Item Description:** Sheet of standard size printer paper with the words OUT OF ORDER printed on them in black ink. Anyone reading the words sees them in their native (first) language. Other than very high durability, this item appears to have no further anomalous properties.
**Date of Recovery:** 8-10-2021
**Location of Recovery:** Taped to a printer in an office building in Manchester, NH
**Current Status:** Taped to a printer in an office in Site 67.

**Item Description:** Small crystal made of smoky quartz. Anyone who holds the crystal involuntarily drops it after 30 seconds, claiming that someone slapped it out of their hand. This effect occurs even if the holder is alone in the room or unaware of any others present.
**Date of Recovery:** 8-13-2021
**Location of Recovery:** Austin, TX
**Current Status:** In low-value item storage.

**Item Description:** A brick of solid white chocolate that registers 7400° Celcius with thermal sensors, but remains completely solid. While the surrounding area is not affected by the extreme heat, organic tissue that makes contact will vaporize. No attempt to transport the block was made.
**Date of Recovery:** 8-17-2021
**Location of Recovery:** A field outside of Hershey, Pennsylvania
**Current Status:** A solid containment block was constructed around the chocolate and is regularly monitored with thermal optics. No one is allowed to attempt consumption.

**Item Description:** A damaged radio found with its batteries removed, but constantly playing static. Indistinct talking could be heard through the static however, and seemed to be on a loop. After subsequent inspection, some vague sentences were discerned: "NATO has confirmed the use of battlefield nuclear weapons in eastern Europe" ... "it's 6 PM Sydney time ██/██/1983, this is ████ news."
**Date of Recovery:** ██/██/2007
**Location of Recovery:** Found partially buried in Wollemi National Park, New South Wales, Australia
**Current Status:** Radio was extracted by foundation agents undercover as park rangers, and is now in Site-98 awaiting further research.  
[[# carlos-the-cool-capybara]]
**Item Description:** A specimen of //Hydrochoerus hydrochaeris// (capybara). The air within a 2.4-meter radius of the object remains at a constant 21.1 degrees Celsius regardless of other conditions. Patches of black hair spell "Carlos the Cool Capybara, by Dr. Wondertainment" on its left side. This designation appears as #3 in [[[scp-4225 |Document 4225-a]]].
**Date of Recovery:** 8-20-2021
**Location of Recovery:** The Chattanooga Zoo, sharing an enclosure with several non-anomalous capybaras. Zoo personnel had no recollection of the object's arrival.
**Current Status:** In low-risk animal containment at Site-66.

**Item Description:** A metallic top that spins indefinitely in a fixed location, with all attempts at halting movement resulting in failure. With the exception of it occasionally deviating from set norm, no other anomalous properties have been discovered as of yet. The rate of such occurrences has not been observed to be fixed. 
**Date of Recovery:** 15/10/2020
**Location of Recovery:** A toy shop in Chinatown, Singapore.
**Current status:** In storage at the Michigan branch of Site-85's Anomalous Item Research Lab.
**Note:** Following a breach in its containment on 20/11/2020, Junior Researcher Lilith Agnes has requested to conduct further testing on this item. Request approval is currently pending.

**Item Description:** Full-length mirror, glass in a wooden frame carved with roses. Any movement reflected in the mirror is a fraction of a second late, just enough to be noticeable. Observers describe this effect as "unnerving" and often "creepy."  Spending a long period of time in line of sight of the mirror causes subjects to become convinced that something is watching them from the mirror, but nothing has been found.
**Date of Recovery:** 31-10-2020
**Location of Recovery:** An antique store in Las Vegas, Nevada.
**Current Status:** Being tested.

**Item Description:** Common //Newton's Cradle// physics toy which, when observed, afflicts the viewer with a strong memetic urge to use it, at which point the memetic urge ends, resurfacing once the toy stops. The toy is imprinted with the logo of ████████ Physics Suppliers. Upon further investigation, none of their other //Newton's Cradle// toys have been shown to be anomalous.
**Date of Recovery:** 1-11-2020
**Location of Recovery:** A physics classroom in ██████████ High School in █████████, Indiana.
**Current Status:** In storage.

**Item Description:** A 128GB USB drive that has to be cracked like a glow stick to function. It stays functional for the same amount of time as an average glow stick, but it can be re-cracked. Re-cracking the drive will change the //Date Modified// of the files between 1-80 years ahead or behind.
**Date of Recovery:** 23-7-1941
**Location of Recovery:** A salt mine in ███████, Romania.
**Current Status:** Being used by Dr.█████ to save some of his paperwork that isn't immediately needed.

**Item Description:** A first edition copy of //The Hobbit// by J.R.R. Tolkien. The book itself displays no anomalous properties. However, its location at the time of discovery makes it relevant to the Foundation.
**Date of Recovery:** 11-6-1989
**Location of Recovery:** Inside a time capsule which had been sealed underground and completely untouched since 1889.
**Current Status:** In storage.
**Note:** //How a book could be sealed in a time capsule almost 50 years before it was written is a mystery that may never be solved.// - Researcher Somerset

+++ Anomalous Items 721 - 730

**Item Description:** A pair of latex gloves that when worn, cannot be removed by the wearer.
**Date of Recovery:** 7-18-2017
**Location of Recovery:** Unavailable
**Current Status:** Currently being worn by Researcher Lantern
//It itches, smells, tight, and its sweaty, its been like this for 3 fucking years and there's nothing I can do about it, My life is a living hell.// - Researcher Lantern

**Item Description:** A baseball cap that can only be removed by the wearer. Any attempt by any--one--thing else to remove the hat reveals only another identical hat where the original hat was. Removed hats de-manifest within 45 minutes. It is theorized that the number of hats that can be revealed in this fashion may be infinite.
**Date of Recovery:** 12-2-2019
**Location of Recovery:** Found in a package mailed to [REDACTED], which was found to be an abandoned house. No sign of the person the package is addressed to has been found.
**Current Status:** Being tested to determine if there is an upper limit to the number of hats created by the item's anomalous property.
**Note:** //After a recent incident filled an interview room with hats, all testing is to be performed outdoors.//

**Item Description:** A 1^^st^^ edition copy of the Yu-Gi-Oh!^^tm^^ card "Pot of Greed" (YGLD-ENB26 Edition), which, at random intervals, changes the description of the card to drawing a different number of cards. 
**Date of Recovery:** 5-3-2021
**Location of Recovery:** Found and subsequently bought off of Ebay by Dr. Laz.
**Current Status:** Framed on a wall in Dr. Laz's office.
**Note:** //Please stop asking what it does, that joke has gotten old.// -Dr. Laz

**Item Description:** A vinyl record called "Makan!" by a Singaporean artist group, "Playlab Team 1", with a different version of the album, belonging to a different person, playing with every playback. Repeated tests show that five people have been identified, with the artists following a cycle. Despite the closing track, "50 Days", and the number of songs staying the same, each artists' version of the album differs in length, genre, production and features, with some identified features from Kanye West, BTS, the entirety of Hololive and Gorillaz. Four of the five voices have been identified to belong to four Media, Arts and Design students from Singapore Polytechnic, with the fifth currently unknown. When interviewed, the identified students claim that they have no memory of recording or producing the album and have no knowledge as to who the fifth person is. In addition, they have confirmed that all songs match and line up with events that have occurred when the group was working together for a group project.
**Date of Recovery:** 25/8/2021
**Location of Recovery:** Curated Records, Singapore.
**Current status:** Sent to Senior Researcher Anthony Fantano for review.
**Note:** //"Strong 10."// -Dr. Fantano

**Item Description:** A set of Japanese manga called "Tales from the Foundation" that has accurately predicted events that occurred throughout the Foundation's history such as terminations, containment breaches, the creations of various anomalies, etc. With the exception of that, the books themselves present no other observable anomalous properties. When contacted, the author claims she has no knowledge of the actual SCP Foundation and that all characters used in her series are original. Investigations are currently ongoing.
**Date of Recovery:** 27/12/2021
**Location of Recovery:** A manga shop in Akihabara, Japan.
**Current Status:** In storage at the Japan branch of Site-85's Anomalous Item Research Lab.
**Note:** //"I hope Dr. Clef doesn't find her (the author's) Pixiv."// -Dr. A. Raki

**Item Description:** A weathered copper statue of the exact shape and size of an average adult female giant horned lizard (Phrynosoma asio) that will spontaneously animate upon coming in contact with sand. The item will require most of which a standard specimen of its species needs except for oxygen whilst animate. It also possesses the ability to defend itself if provoked and/or threatened in a pointed manner by expelling hot water produced via unknown means from its eyes at the perceived threat.
**Date of Recovery:** 06-14-18██
**Location of Recovery:** ██████, Québec, Canada
**Current Status:** --In storage.-- Contained within a standard terrarium in Dr. M. Frosch’s office.

**Item Description:** A disposable vape pen that creates a cloud of mustard gas when exhaled. The person inhaling the cloud gets a normal cloud, it only turns into mustard gas on the exhale.
**Date of Recovery:** 03-14-2021
**Location of Recover:** A high school courtyard in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
**Current Status:** Hidden in a drawer in the on-site employee break room.

**Item description:** A broken lamp of unremarkable make. If any attempt towards fixing it is made, the item will proceed to revert itself back to its damaged state through unknown means.
**Date of Recovery:** 04-06-2019
**Location of Recovery:** Seneca Landfill, Pennsylvania, US
**Current Status:** In storage.

**Item Description:** A 3.9-kg calico cat (//Felis catus//) that, when vocalizing, does not produce the expected sounds, but rather human imitations thereof. "Meow" is the most common; others include "murr," "urrt," and "mrow." Although the cat is female, the human voice is very low in pitch, resembling that of singer Barry White. Purring is unaffected. Testing revealed no other anomalous properties.
**Date of Recovery:** 6/30/2017
**Location of Recovery:** Animal shelter in London, Ontario, Canada.
**Current Status:** Low-security animal containment unit at Site-17.

**Item Description:** A AKM assault rifle chambered in 7.62 x 39mm, with no discernable serial number. Testing has shown that it can accept all magazines compatible with the platform. Rifle would not fire when being used by any user whose nationality is outside of the Warsaw Pact countries, including individuals whose country is modeled on the communist system. When being fired by an individual who meets the criteria, the rifle would function as normal. 
**Date of Recovery:** 05/18/1977
**Location of Recovery:** Decrepit warehouse near the Port of New York. Found sitting on top of an empty steamer trunk among other unclaimed cargo by Foundation field agents doing a routine check of the area. 
**Current Status:** --Stored in site security weapons locker at Site 38.--  Destroyed in 1979 along with a cache of small arms captured from the Chaos Insurgency.
**Note:** //The only guy that was able to fire this thing was the supply truck driver Raphael from Logistics, who immigrated to the United States from Uzbekistan. He had never fired a gun in his life. We showed him all the stances and everything, but it all went out the window when he pulled the trigger. The recoil from the entire mag emptying made him stumble and drop it. We forgot to set the thing to semi-auto. Luckily nobody was hurt, but Dr. Flaten wasn’t amused.//-Researcher Penderson (6/23/1977) 

+++ Anomalous Items 731 - 740

**Item Description:** A 5.4cm ceramic figurine of the character Flupke, from //Quick & Flupke//. The paint is slightly flaked, and the initials "K.G." are written on the base in pencil. In writing, the item can only be referred to in English. The effect does not grant proficiency with written English; an individual's command of the language directly constrains their ability to record written information about the item at all. Spoken communication is unaffected.
**Date of Recovery:** 14/11/1989
**Location of Recovery:** Among personal effects at hastily-abandoned PoI-███ safehouse in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea.
**Current Status:** Standard containment locker at Site-102.

**Item Description:** A post mount mailbox of unremarkable make belonging to no known address. When any subject above the age of ten (10) comes into contact with the item, it will proceed to rapidly regress their mental state to that of a newborn infant through unknown means.
**Date of Recovery:** 03-09-2012
**Location of Recovery:** Bikini Atoll, Marshall Islands, Pacific Ocean
**Current Status:** [DATA EXPUNGED]

**Item Description:** A pataphysical entity dressed in a crimson-red suit of unknown brand wearing an opaque, circular glass visor. The entity is three feet, ten inches (3’10”) tall and bipedal, but has no discernible arms. It will appear behind an individual (hereafter referred to as the subject) that has recently translated the English word "gosh" to Filipino via Google Translate within minutes. The entity has been reported to laugh at the subject and call them a "sussy baka" before viciously maiming them with a three-inch combat knife. It is unknown where said weapon comes from and how it manages this despite having no arms.
**Date of Recovery:** 02-09-2021
**Location of Recovery:** Sedgwick, Kansas
**Current Status:** Contained within a humanoid containment chamber as of writing. It is heavily recommended that Foundation personnel not translate the word "gosh" to Filipino via Google Translate for their own safety.
**Note:**//Get out of my head get out of my head get out of my head get out of my head get out of my he-.// - Dr. Laz

**Item Description:** A doughnut that spontaneously regenerates itself after a bite is taken from it.
**Date of Recovery:** 03-11-2015
**Location of Recovery:** Davenport, Iowa
**Current status:** Lunch item in Site-19's cafeteria

**Item Description:** A black-and-white photograph of a spiral pattern that will display letters of the English alphabet when viewed from a 90° angle and occasionally form legible words or phrases. The most commonly viewed word or phrase seen so far was "unus annus" as of writing, which translated from Latin means "one year" in English.
**Date of Recovery:** 11-12-2019
**Location of Recovery:** Cape Elizabeth, Maine
**Current Status:** Disappeared shortly after recovery for unknown reasons.

**Item Description:** A blue ping-pong ball, regulation size. Item displays mild anti-memetic properties when not being directly viewed. Its existence is gradually forgotten over the next three to four hours. Reminding a subject of the existence of the item halts the effect temporarily, but the effect inevitably returns. This does little more than reset the clock on the anomalous effect, in a manner of speaking. Apart from this effect, the item is non-anomalous.
**Date of Recovery:** 12-12-2012
**Location of Recovery:** Charity ping-pong tournament in Cincinnati, OH
**Current Status:** In the recreation area of Site-54, for use during non-working hours.
**Note:** //It is admittedly somewhat odd to add an item to this log several years after its recovery. The item was originally placed in storage, where it was forgotten and rediscovered on multiple occasions.// - Researcher Lopez

**Item Description**: A BMX bicycle that will stand on its own while no other forces are being applied to it.
**Location of Recovery**: At a garage sale in Firestone, Colorado
**Date or Recovery**: 03-04-2007
**Current Status**: Housed in Dr.[REDACTED]’s garage.

**Item Description:** A sheet of standard printer paper with the logo of popular fast food chain [REDACTED] drawn on it in black marker. Any human subject viewing the item immediately becomes hungry, regardless of how recent their last meal was, and experiences a mild compulsion to purchase food from the associated chain. This compulsion can be easily shaken off, and both effects end within 5 minutes of the item being removed from view.
**Location of Recovery:** Abandoned on a park bench in Miami
**Date of Recovery:** 9-25-2021
**Current Status:** In low-value item storage.
**Note:**//The bench the item was found on was within line of sight of a restaurant belonging to the chain in question. I'd say it was a coincidence, but you never know in this line of work.// - Agent Thompson

**Item Description:** An apple that is unanimously agreed to be a vegetable.
**Date of Recovery:** 7-11-2015
**Location of Recovery:** The Pentagon, Arlington County, Virginia.
**Current Status:** Site-111's Secondary Storage.

**Item Description:** A small 2.5cm x 2.5cm x 2.5cm wooden cube, with a magnetic field. Magnetic field has measured to have a similar strength to a neodymium magnet. 
**Date of Recovery:** 8-5-2019
**Location of Recovery:** ████████ Community High School, Physical Science Lab. 
**Current Status:** In storage. 
//Notes: I’m honestly not even sure what we’re supposed to do with this. Sure it’s odd, but what’s the point? -Researcher Vance// 

+++ Anomalous Items 741 - 750

**Item Description:** A 16mm sound film print of the educational film //Charlie Brown Clears The Air//, released in 1979, with a yellowed sticker on the reel indicating that it is the property of Site-14. Testing of the film reveals no anomalous qualities. When the item is played using a compatible projector in an enclosed area, the audience will be exposed to high CO2 levels at 1,000 ppm from an unknown origin at approximately the 1:02 mark, corresponding to the segment where Snoopy revs his motorcycle. Effect will subside at the 1:23 mark. Further CO2 levels at approximately 150 ppm were observed from the 1:35 to 4:44 mark, with a brief spike to 250 ppm from 4:45 to 4:49, afterwards returning to 150 ppm for the duration of Charlie Brown’s presentation. Effects end during the end title card, with levels returning to normal. 
**Date of Recovery:** 6/10/2015
**Location of Recovery:** Discovered at Site-14 in a desk drawer by Dr. Plotts and Agent Griffin while refurbishing old furniture from a storage unit on their break time. Surviving records indicate that the wooden desk was previously located in the now-defunct Site-14 Film Repository, which was decommissioned in 2008.
**Current Status:** --Used to calibrate CO2 detectors.-- Relocated to the site history display case near the cafeteria, accompanied by a placard explaining the unique properties and history of the item.
**Note:** //Use of this item for calibrating CO2 devices has been discontinued due to far more safer and efficient methods. Personnel wishing to calibrate their CO2 detector should speak to Researcher Gutierrez for further information.// -Dr. Plotts

**Item Description:** A very wonderful, beautiful lamp. When anybody tries to describe said gorgeous lamp in either verbal or nonverbal form, they inadvertently mention how pretty it looks. 
**Date of Recovery:** 8/15/2020
**Location of Discovery:** Dr. Graham’s Office
**Current Status:** Kept in Dr. Graham’s Office, where it stands in it’s beautiful form.

**Item Description:** A rock that forces anyone that views it question their gender, regardless of how they identify.
**Date of Recovery:** 3/06/21
**Location of Discovery:** An abandoned backpack filled with other non-anomalous rocks found in █████████, California. May be related to [[[SCP-113]]].
**Current Status:** --On display in Dr. Nin's office.-- Standard containment locker at Site-██.
**Note:** //Gender is already confusing, I don't really need another thing making it harder for me. I recommend that all cisgender people look at this, though.// - Dr. Nin

**Item Description:** A audio file of a unused ring tone intended for the "HTC Magic" Android phone. The ring tone itself is a 30 second loop of a ska jazz song. If the song’s beats are rearranged by audio editing, the melody of the musical piece will not change, regardless of the edit’s severity.
**Date of Recovery:** 7/5/2014 (Seventh of May, 2014)
**Location of Recovery:** In a post from www.█████, a forum website dedicated to discovering and showing phenomena from old, unpopular smartphones.
**Current Status:** Stored at Site-█’s containment lockers in a USB-Flash drive. Witnesses tracked and amnestisized.

**Item Description:** A red male //Hypostomus plecostomus//. Other then its color it appears completely average. When placed on anything the color red it will gain speed, the more color the faster. When removed from the red item it quickly slows down. 
**Date of Recovery:** 7-20-2021 
**Location of Recovery:** An aquarium store in ██████████, Iowa. 
**Current Status:** Contained in a 284 liter fish tank alongside several non-anomalous fish at Site-███. nothing red is allowed within three meters of the tank, this includes other fish. 
**Additional Notes:** //Oooh blood fish, beautiful! - Dr. Lily Scarlett//

**Item Description:** The carcass of an adult beluga whale (//Delphinapterus leucas//). Despite being recovered in 2006, the item does not appear to have advanced past Stage 4 of decomposition. No other anomalous properties have been noted.
**Date of Recovery:** 8/25/2006
**Location of Recovery:** A beach in Sakhalin, Russia
**Current Status:** Kept in cold storage at Site-77.
**Note:** //Ech. Disgusting.// -Dr. Clyde

**Item Description:** A banana that can shoot bullets.It is unknown where these bullets come from.
**Date of Recovery:** 2/10/2011
**Location of Recovery:** A grocery store in Montana,
**Current Status:** Contained in a 24 cm thick glass box in site-██
**Notes:**  The item doesn't seem to rot.

**Item Description:** A 1990 Suzuki Samurai that whenever observed directly will appear to be a stick of butter. Testing reveals that subjects can interact with the car as if it were a stick of butter rather than a car.
**Date of Recovery:** 9/8/2001
**Location of Recovery:** ███████, Indianapolis.
**Notes:** //Took us forever to figure out what the owner of the store was talking about. -Dr. Black//

**Item Description:** A baseball that, when thrown at advertisements of any type, renders the advertisement blank. "AWCY?" is stitched into it.
**Date of Recovery:** 10/30/2021
**Location of Recovery:** The ████████ Stadium in ████████.
**Current Status:** In storage.
**Notes:**  The item is believed to be the work of the group of interest "Are We Cool Yet?"
